discourse_list.title: Is there a need for a decentralized rfp process?

content.content: Hello, I’m conducting research into whether an org like Maker has a need to find new trustworthy vendors for non-continuous (contract) work? Is there a need for a more efficient (preferably decentralized) RPF and bidding and contracting process? A symptom of such a need might be that there are a narrow selection of vendors and reliance on networking/referrals for any novel work, which would suggest that choice in qualified vendors is limited. Any thoughts welcome, and apologies if this is the wrong place to ask. Best, B

I recommend you to go to the official Maker Discord. There I think it would be the best place to ask.    Discord    Join the MakerDAO Official Discord Discord Server! Welcome to MakerDAO’s Official Discord server! MakerDAO governs Dai, the world’s leading decentralized stablecoin. | 2,803 members
This topic was automatically closed 90 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
